thread.title: Do NOT lock up 'low risk' paedophiles claims Britain’s top child protection officer
thread.title_full: Do NOT lock up 'low risk' paedophiles claims Britain’s top child protection officer

title: Do NOT lock up 'low risk' paedophiles claims Britain’s top child protection officer
text:
We have reached saturation point… Senior Child Protection Officer Simon Bailey 
“We have reached saturation point… The police service has responded to the threat but it has now reached that point whereby we have to try and turn the tide. We have to look at alternatives.”Police receive on average, 112 complaints a day, with more than 70,000 investigations a year. Forces are also preparing for an estimated 40,000 reports of abuse from the Independent Inquiry into Child Sexual Abuse. 
Mr Bailey added: “How can the police service be expected to cope with all that if, we are still having to deal with very, very low-risk offenders?“Those individuals that you can say with a degree of certainty genuinely don’t pose a physical threat — that to me seems to be a reasonable line [for an alternative approach].” The World's Most Corrupt Countries Wed, January 25, 2017 The lowest ranked nations were, according to the group Transparency International, all plagued by 'conflict and war, poor governance, weak public institutions like police and the judiciary and a lack of independence in the media.'
